title: Elon Musk Makes ‘Overstaffed’ Fed Target in Quest for Efficiency | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Elon Musk Makes ‘Overstaffed’ Fed Target in Quest for Efficiency

Publication Date: January 2024

Source: Bloomberg

Elon Musk has targeted the Federal Reserve, describing it as 'absurdly overstaffed' in a recent social media post. This criticism comes as he prepares to lead a new agency aimed at increasing government efficiency.

  • Musk claims the Federal Reserve employs too many staff compared to similar institutions.
  • Approximately 24,000 people worked at the Federal Reserve last year.
  • Musk is set to lead the Department of Government Efficiency, which aims for significant spending cuts.
  • Trump has previously criticized the Federal Reserve and its chair, Jerome Powell.
“I have thousands of hard-working people — economists, jurists, computer scientists — and I can assure you that they work super hard every day, not just once a month.” - Christine Lagarde

This commentary on the Federal Reserve aligns with Trump's earlier criticisms and highlights an ongoing debate about government efficiency.
newTitle: Elon Musk Critiques Federal Reserve Staffing in Push for Government Efficiency

​7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations - Times Now
summary:
7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024, Source: Times Now Digital

Working along the lines of Atmanirbhar Bharat, India is witnessing the growth of electric mobility with the introduction to electric vehicles, and less dependence on fuel. Here are 7 Indian states/UTs with the highest EV public charging stations, contributing to its growth.

  • Karnataka: 5,765 EV charging stations
  • Maharashtra: 3,728 EV charging stations
  • Delhi: 1,941 EV charging stations
  • Uttar Pradesh: 1,989 EV charging stations
  • Tamil Nadu: 1,413 EV charging stations
  • Kerala: 1,212 EV charging stations
  • Rajasthan: 1,129 EV charging stations
“Karnataka has set the benchmark with 5,765 public EV stations in India, recording the highest number of charging stations in the country.”

This boost in EV infrastructure is pivotal for India's move towards sustainable transportation and reduced carbon emissions.
newTitle: 7 Indian States/UTs With Highest EV Public Charging Stations

title: Who Was Epigamia CEO Rohan Mirchandani, Who Died Of Cardiac Arrest At 41 - NDTV
This billionaire, once world's richest, lost $32 billion in 2024. It's not Jeff Bezos - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bernard Arnault's $32 Billion Loss in 2024: The Billionaire Who Fell from the Top

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bernard Arnault, once the richest person in the world, has experienced a staggering $32 billion loss in 2024, dropping him to the fifth position on the Billionaires Index.

  • Arnault's net worth decreased to $176 billion after a significant 20% fall in LVMH's stock attributed to geopolitical tensions.
  • This decline resulted in a loss of $54 billion in revenue.
  • He has fluctuated between the top ranks multiple times, previously gaining the title in 2021 due to a surge in luxury goods sales.
  • Arnault is now behind notable billionaires like Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, and Mark Zuckerberg.
  • Despite the drop, LVMH continues to dominate the luxury market with a portfolio of 75 brands.
“LVMH's revenue drop is attributed to ongoing geopolitical tensions across the globe,” said CFO Jean-Jacques Guiony.

Arnault’s status reflects the volatility of wealth among the world’s richest, showcasing the impact of broader economic challenges on luxury markets.
newTitle: Bernard Arnault's $32 Billion Loss in 2024: The Billionaire Who Fell from the Top

title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Latest GMP, subscription status, should you apply on last day | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO Day 3 Live Updates

Date & Source: 23 Dec, 2024 - LiveMint

The initial public offering (IPO) of Dam Capital Advisors Ltd has entered its third and last day of bidding today. The company aims to raise ₹840.25 crore from the issue, which is entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares.

  • The price band for the IPO is ₹269 to ₹283 per share.
  • The issue is heavily oversubscribed, with a total subscription of 24.46 times as of now.
  • The retail segment has been subscribed 18 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) segment is at 51.62 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) for the IPO is ₹161, indicating a strong demand.
"The DAM Capital Advisors IPO shows strong demand and positive trends, with expectations for substantial returns on investment."

The IPO is set to close today and interested investors are encouraged to apply before the deadline.

More Pain Likely, Market Expert Says After Bitcoin's Biggest Loss Since August - CoinDesk
summary:
More Pain Likely, Market Expert Says After Bitcoin's Biggest Loss Since August

Date: Dec 23, 2024

Source: CoinDesk

Bitcoin's recent 8% price drop has led market expert Andre Dragosch to caution investors about potential further losses, suggesting it may present a 'buy the dip' opportunity.

  • The recent decline saw Bitcoin fall nearly 8.8% to around $95,000.
  • The Federal Reserve's stance on future rate cuts has contributed to negative sentiment in the markets.
  • The increase in Treasury yields and a stronger dollar further impacts cryptocurrencies negatively.
  • Dragosch previously predicted a significant BTC rally despite market skepticism.
  • He notes the ongoing BTC supply deficit could present a buying opportunity amidst the downturn.
The Fed is scared of this scenario which is why Powell will probably do too little/too late… Expect more pain over the coming weeks. — André Dragosch

In summary, while short-term pain seems likely, there may be long-term benefits for investors capitalizing on Bitcoin's supply constraints.
newTitle: Market Expert Predicts More Losses After Bitcoin's Recent Drop

title: India Cements soars 11% as UltraTech Cement’s stake buyout gets CCI nod - Upstox
summary:
India Cements soars 11% as UltraTech Cement’s stake buyout gets CCI nod

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: The Economic Times

Shares of India Cements surged 11% in early trade on Monday after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) approved UltraTech Cement Ltd’s controlling stake in The India Cements Ltd.

Under the approved deal, UltraTech Cement will acquire a 32.72% stake in India Cements from its promoters and members of the promoter group, as well as from Sri Saradha Logistics Private Limited. UltraTech will make an open offer to acquire up to 26 percent more of the paid-up equity share capital of India Cements, taking its total potential shareholding to nearly 59%.

  • CCI approved UltraTech Cement’s acquisition of 32.72% stake in India Cements.
  • UltraTech will also make an open offer to acquire an additional 26% stake.
  • The transaction aims to provide UltraTech majority control over India Cements.
  • India Cements stock was trading at ₹365.00, up 7.62% from Friday's close.
“The Proposed Combination envisages UltraTech Cement Limited’s acquisition of 32.72% of the paid-up equity share capital of The India Cements Limited.”

This acquisition reflects UltraTech's strategic move to strengthen its position in the Indian cement market.
newTitle: India Cements soars 11% as UltraTech Cement’s stake buyout gets CCI nod

title: Gold price holds comfortably above $2,600 mark; lacks bullish conviction - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Prices Show Modest Gains Amid USD Dip Buying

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: FXStreet

The gold price has increased for the third consecutive day, mainly supported by geopolitical risks and trade tensions, although momentum remains limited due to rising US dollar strength and Treasury yields.

  • Gold price ticks higher for the third straight day, lacking strong follow-through.
  • Geopolitical risks and trade war fears continue to support gold as a safe haven.
  • The US dollar's hawkish signals and elevated bond yields limit gold's upside potential.
  • Recent economic indicators show inflation moderation in the US.
  • Continued tensions in international relations, particularly Russia-Ukraine and Middle East conflicts, remain influential.
  • Market anticipation surrounds the upcoming release of the Conference Board's Consumer Confidence Index.
“The Federal Reserve last week signaled that it would slow the pace of rate cuts, lifting the benchmark US Treasury bond yield to its highest level in more than six months.”

In conclusion, while gold prices are showing some recovery, market dynamics suggest that potential gains may be restrained in the short term as traders await further economic indicators.
newTitle: Gold Prices Show Modest Gains Amid USD Dip Buying

title: Zomato share price declines as it joins 30-share SENSEX; Here's how all constituents are performing - Upstox
summary:
Zomato Share Price Declines as it Joins 30-Share SENSEX

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Upstox

Zomato’s shares fell on its debut on the SENSEX index, experiencing a decline as it replaced JSW Steel in the index. Despite this, the company has shown substantial growth over the past year.

  • Zomato's share price dropped 3% to ₹273.15 and closed down 0.37% at ₹280.80.
  • The stock has risen 38% in six months and 124.79% year-to-date.
  • In Q2 FY25, Zomato reported a 388.8% increase in consolidated profit after tax to ₹176 crore.
  • Revenue from operations increased by 68.5% to ₹4,799 crore.
  • The broader SENSEX was up 779 points, driven by major players like HDFC Bank and Reliance.
“Investors should note that past performance is not an indicator of future returns.”

In conclusion, while Zomato’s entry into SENSEX was marked by an initial decline in stock price, the company shows significant growth potential based on its recent financial performance.
newTitle: Zomato Share Price Declines upon Joining SENSEX

title: Siemens India shares tumble 3% today, extending losses for the fifth straight day; here’s why - Upstox
summary:
Siemens India shares tumble 3% today, extending losses for the fifth straight day; here’s why

Date: December 23, 2023 | Source: Unknown

Siemens Limited shares faced a nearly 3% drop today, marking the fifth consecutive day of losses due to weak management commentary and lowered expectations for HVDC orders in India.

  • Shares opened lower, falling 2.8% to a low of ₹6,676.5 on the NSE.
  • Management lowered HVDC order expectations during an analyst call.
  • Concerns emerged over a slowdown in railway order flow and private capital expenditure.
  • Despite a strong performance in new-age tech sectors, traditional technology spending remains sluggish.
  • Company reported a 45.4% rise in net profit for Q4 2023 compared to the previous year.
“Though private capex remains steady in certain high-growth areas, it has been sluggish in traditional technologies.”

The recent market decline reflects broader concerns about Siemens’ performance and future order flows, especially in HVDC technology.
newTitle: Siemens India Shares Drop 3% Amidst Weak Management Outlook

title: Thepla And A Drink: Liquor On Debut Surat-Bangkok Flight Runs Out, Officials Say... - NDTV
summary:
Liquor Runs Out on Inaugural Surat-Bangkok Flight, Say Passengers

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Air India Express' debut flight from Surat to Bangkok experienced high demand for liquor, with claims from passengers that the stock had run out, though officials disputed this.

  • The inaugural flight lasted four hours and had 175 passengers aboard.
  • Officials stated that there was sufficient liquor and food on the flight contrary to social media claims.
  • Liquor use is banned in Gujarat; however, it was available on this private flight.
  • Passengers were served different types of liquors with varying prices during the flight.
The airline offers five types of liquor onboard. A 50 ml of Chivas Regal is priced at ₹ 600.

Overall, despite some complaints, the airline maintained they had enough stock to serve all passengers.
newTitle: Liquor Runs Out on Inaugural Surat-Bangkok Flight, Say Passengers

Billionaire Anil Agarwal-led mining major Vedanta Limited has revised its proposed demerger plan, now choosing to retain its Base Metals undertaking within the parent firm.

title: Bharat Global Developers shares, which rose 2,300% in the last 12 months, are now suspended for trading - CNBCTV18
summary:
Bharat Global Developers shares now suspended for trading

Publication Date: Dec 23, 2024 9:09 AM IST | Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of Bharat Global Developers Ltd. have been suspended from trading following a dramatic rise in value over the past year, as ordered by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI).

  • Shares surged 105x from November 2023 to 2024.
  • SEBI's order cites concerns over suspicious financial disclosures made by the company.
  • The company previously reported negligible revenue, with a sudden spike in the latest financial quarter.
  • Management overhaul in December 2023 led to claims of significant business expansion.
  • Noticees restricted from accessing capital markets and required to submit asset inventories.
SEBI noted potential attempts to mislead investors through false disclosures and fabricated contracts.

The suspension highlights regulatory action against misleading financial practices in the market.
newTitle: Bharat Global Developers Shares Suspended After 2,300% Surge
